The game is a steal for $15, it\'s easily going to be worth upwards of $50 when it is fully finished.

A wonder myself. There are so many people that working on ksp every day, and the game cost only $15. Are the dev really make there money with this?

At the moment, the donations and initial $15 fee is just to keep the project afloat while the game is in development. If anything, I expect they\'re probably losing money at the moment. When the game is finally released fully, then they\'ll recoup their losses.

The prognosis is good, after all it\'s a unique game with very little competition (The only \'game\' which comes close is Orbiter, which has a totally different ethos and feel to it) by releasing it in a developing alpha mode they\'re building up a dedicated fanbase, with a strong modding community which will be on hand to promote and advise customers when the full game is released.

I don\'t think that it will be an \'angry-birds\' style mega-hit, it\'s too complicated for that; and I don\'t think it will be a \'Skyrim\' style blockbuster (They don\'t have the advertising budget for that) but I predict it will be a sleeper hit which should make Squad a decent enough amount of money to start working on KSP II

I daresay they have a large stockpile of funding from the early days where KSP sold like the proverbial hot cakes.

I believe kevinlacht was not intending to pry into anyone\'s personal business, but rather expressing kindly concern for the welfare of the people who are laboring so hard to give us such a delightful product at such a low price. I also hope they are prospering and not having to make sacrifices.

I\'m with you, Vanamonde, but on the other hand I also agree with Zmapus. This reminds me of a few Minecraft threads in which people speculated on Notch\'s wealth, eventually leading to a bit of undeserved resentment of his wealth and/or what he was doing with his life and money in general, something completely out of bounds.

Squad was a successful business long before KSP came along. They have the extra profits to put into the development of KSP.

Think about that for a second. How does *any* game get made if they don\'t even have a preview to sell like KSP? Some games take 5+ years to develop and it is sustained without selling anything.

The bottom line here is that this is not something we need to worry about, just like we don\'t worry about the next version of of any AAA title.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
